availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Melissa Calvert. Father of Sarah Calvert, William Calvert, and John T. Calvert. Farmer in Scott County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Scott County in 1850. Farmer in Scott County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Scott County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 2, p. 475B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 2, p. 650.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 953.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 225A.
"Andrew Calvert (1797-1871)," Find A Grave, Memorial 59385461, accessed October 12, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/59385461.
